required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Albumin-bound Paclitaxel Plus S-1 Versus SOX as First-line Treatment in Advanced or Recurrent Gastric Adenocarcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Open-label, Randomized Controlled Study of Albumin-bound Paclitaxel Plus S-1 Versus Oxaliplatin Plus S-1 (SOX) as First-line Treatment in Advanced or Recurrent Gastric Adenocarcinoma

lead_sponsor.agency: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: It is a trial to compare the efficacy and safety of Albumin-bound Paclitaxel plus S-1 versus Oxaliplatin plus S-1 (SOX) as first-line treatment in advanced or recurrent gastric adenocarcinoma.

primary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as time from the start of treatment to progression of disease or death.

secondary_outcome.description: The rate of participants that achieve either a complete response (CR) or a partial response (PR).
Overall survival is defined as time from the start of treatment until death due to any reason.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as measured by number and grade of adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: Summary adverse events according to NCI-CTCAE 4.03

arm_group.description: Patients in this arm receive chemotherapy with Albumin-bound Paclitaxel plus S-1.
Patients in this arm receive chemotherapy with Oxaliplatin plus S-1.

intervention.description: Albumin-bound Paclitaxel 260mg/m2 IV on D1 plus S-1 80mg/m2 PO (Bid) on D1-14 every 21 days.
Oxaliplatin 130mg/m2 IV on D1 plus S-1 80mg/m2 PO (Bid) on D1-14 every 21 days.

facility.name: Tongji hospital of Tongji Medical College, Huazhong University of Science and Technology

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Huazhong University of Science and Technology
responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor, Head of the cancer center
